headline: Classic Ham Glaze
description: Make this easy ham glaze with just brown sugar, honey, and orange juice to add that classic sweet and tangy coating to your baked holiday ham.
name: Classic Ham Glaze

recipeInstructions.text: Mix brown sugar, orange juice, and honey together in a bowl until the brown sugar has dissolved.

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this glaze twice now, once to style up basic grilled pork chops and the other time on grilled fresh pineapple slices. Between the sugar and the honey, I knew it would be a bit too sweet for us. I did give it a pretty healthy squeeze of fresh lemon juice which toned down the sweetness, but that’s personal taste kicking in. Worked out well on both dishes, and I feel certain it'd be a winner for glazed ham.

Fast and simple to make
Delicious 
It’s a keeper 
Thank you

I made this for Easter this year, 2021. Everyone absolutely loved it! In the past I have used the syrup from a large can of pineapple but I couldn’t find any this year. I checked All Recipes for something new and different. This was a huge hit! Thanks for sharing!
Followed the basic recipe. I however did not have enough honey and added a tablespoon of molasses. I also added a 1/8 teaspoon of ground cloves. Would highly recommend this recipe.
Very tasty, very simple. The best recipes are tasty and simple, so this gets me 5 stars.

I did not like this recipe. Aside from the lack of instructions, I did not like the taste. The honey flavor was overpowering. Maybe some spices would have helped. I mixed the ingredients, then poured it over the ham. It was runny and didn't stick to it. I baked the ham an additional 15 minutes with the glaze and it all pooled in the bottom of the pan. I had to pour it on the ham like gravy. (which I later regretted when i tasted it) I feel like I should have cooked the glaze in a sauce pan to thicken it first, but that wasn't mentioned in the directions. Safe to say, I will not be making it again.
Perfection. Poured the glaze on and baked the ham covered in foil. Very moist and tasty.
It was tasty, but was too much/too sweet for my wife. I thought it tasted good. Will try tweaking it a bit next time and review again.
Solid choice and well liked.

This is an excellent glaze and I will use it every time I make a ham. I had guests for New Year Day ham, everyone raved about the flavor of the glaze. So simple but really good. I studded the ham with cloves and the combined flavor was excellent.
Only difference was we added 2 teaspoons of cinnamon. Very nice and simple. Definitely will use again!

Wonderful and so simple -- an excellent base! Leaves plenty of room for creativity. I changed it up a bit, and added 1/4 cup pineapple juice and 1/4 cup of orange juice, instead of a 1/2 cup of orange juice. I also added 3 tsp hot sweet mustard, about 1/4 tsp of ground ginger and about a TBS of grated orange peel. The pan gravy tasted so good with this glaze!
Just like it says, traditional glaze. Very good, wouldn't change a anything.

Thought this would taste like a shoe. To my delight it tasted like a shoe with pineapple. Felt like Julia Child’s in that movie where she goes to Italy and preys on Hungry Young men in cafes.4 stars. For the movie, not the recipe.
Really simple and yummy. I only had orange/pineapple juice and it was super yummy.

Excellent basic recipe. I added 1/2 tsp of cinnamon and 1/4 tsp of cloves (I would have added more of both, but my daughter prefers very sweet ham sauce). I only had 1/3 cup of honey, so I used maple syrup to make up the rest. 
I put all the ingredients in a saucepan and heated them to a boil, then glazed my ham every thirty minutes. I saved the rest to use as a sauce. 
I'm so glad I found this; I've been making hit-or-miss glazes for the last ten years.
Percect!
Very simple to make . Basted my ham all during baking time and my tasted fantastic! This will definitely be my glaze I will use from now on.
This was so good! Made exactly as stated, not too sweet at all and gave the ham a very good flavor. Thank you for sharing :)

Made this glaze today for the easter ham. It was my first time being in charge of the ham so i was hoping to make a good impression. Everyone in my family complimented how great the ham was multiple times... Even the very picky eaters that seem to always find something to complain about. My son said it looked like food you would see on a tv commercial it looked so good, lol. Very easy. very good. Will definetly make again and would recommend to everyone.
Classic, super-simple and tasty. This is now my go-to glaze :)

Before putting on the glaze I rubbed the ham with maple syrup and brown sugar. I basted the ham every half hour. With a 1/2 hour left I heated the glaze until it thickened. I wish I would of done that from the start to have it stick a little better to the ham. The flavor was great.

I'm not a huge fan of ham but WOW! This is the only way I will.ever prepare a ham again. I used a spiral sliced ham instead of a whole ham. I also doubled the glaze and warmed it in a saucepan to help the sugar dissolve before basting each slice of ham. After about an hour in the oven, I basted the slces again. It took some time but well worth it. Honey baked Ham has nothing on this recipe!
Nice, simple glaze. I used it on a ham steak when I pan fried it, and my husband liked the flavor and how juicy it kept the ham. Thank you!

I bought a spiral sliced ham and the glaze packet was missing from the package so I searched Allrecipes and found this one. It was so easy and way better than the one that usually comes with the ham. I love that it's all real ingredients, natural. I'll use this one from now on.
The best.
Easy to make and tastes great with our spiral ham for Thanksgiving! Added during the last 15 minutes of cooking.
I made my ham with the glaze and it was delicious or as my grown kids said "it rocked". I would use it again and again. Thank you so much.

I made this for Thanksgiving, and everyone here enjoyed it! Like another reviewer, I did not have enough honey on hand. Therefore, I used 1/4 cup honey and 1/4 cup pure Maple syrup. My husband isn't really a fan of honey, so this substitution turned out perfect for him! For years, I always made the glaze with mustard. But this recipe will certainly replace it!

This is a nice, quick and easy glaze, but it IS VERY sweet. A lot of reviewers claim it's not that sweet, but IMO it's extremely sweet. The ingredients are: honey, brown sugar and orange juice. I guess if you drink a lot of soda and/or consume a lot of sweets, this might not seem that sweet to you, but I don't eat sugary things that often.
This glaze is excellent and super easy!! I am to use this on every ham I make from now on!!!

I switched up this recipe quite a bit but it came out fabulous. I used dark brown sugar , cutie juice, honey and about a table spoon full of jim beam. Combined all ingredients in a small pot, whisked it all together until the sugar dissolved and let it come to a boil. Taste it and if it has too much liquor in it add more cutie juice and honey.
I made this for a ham that I took to a pot luck on Christmas Day. The ham was very moist and tasty. I have cooked ham before without a glaze and it seemed to be dryer. I will definitely use it again.

It is so delish, I couldn't stop tasting it.. The only change I made is, I put cloves in the ham before basting it with the glaze.This glaze is a definite keeper!!!!!! It is so easy and fast to make, and really NO clean up. Don't think I would ever use another store bought glaze again....
Very good. I in deed added a little bit of cloves and a dash of cinnamon and I loved it!

Made as instructed. As a mom with a toddler, loved how quick and easy this was. Tasted good, nothing extraordinary, but it fit the bill! Might try tinkering with it sometime when I have more time...thinking about maybe adding some mustard or apricot, or maybe some cloves.
I made this glaze following the directions. It was just sweet enough (and I like things sweet). My daughter really liked it too. I will definitely try this again.
Very good as is. Followed directions exactly. Will be my go to glaze.

Delicious! My family raved about this glaze. Really made this the star of our Easter dinner. I didn't have orange juice and substituted with pineapple juice. Added some bits of crushed pineapple too. Would definitely make this again.

I made the recipe exactly how it is written. That said, there were no directions on what to do with it! So, after cooking my 6 pound ham (covered) for 30 minutes at 325 degrees I put on the glaze. I recovered and cooked another 30 minutes, but I basted it after 15 to keep it moist. It turned out great! Note: I started with a fully cooked ham.
I love it. Perfect combination & super easy to cut in half if you don't need that much glaze. Thank you for sharing!
Awesome. I just added a little lime juice for extra citrus kick and let it reduce down a bit. Delicious.
Turned out great! Prepared it as directed but added 1 tsp of ground mustard. Added great flavor to the ham

This is probably the 4th or 5th year I've used this recipe. Easy and amazingly delicious! I don't even both to use the ham glaze that comes with the ham. Only change I made was to double and sometimes triple this - only because I really really really love the flavor. My husband, who says he doesn't like ham, even loves how the ham turns out with this simple recipe.
Very good!

I just made this for my Easter ham. It was super easy. I cooked my ham for about 7 hours at 250 degrees in the oven. It came out so moist and fork tender. I will deffinately use this recipe everytime I make a ham. Thanks for sharing it Lindsey.
Simple. Easy. Delicious. Not to sweet. Ham came out moist and tender. A big hit!
I didn't have any orange juice, so I substituted with pineapple juice. It was great!! Added some pineapple junks and everyone loved it!!!
Tasted great on my ham that I made today.. I'm glad I made this :)
Outstanding. Reminds me of my mothers glaze. I use it on pork chops and pork roasts as well.

Excellent recipe! I prepare just as directed and have made this a regular in our dinner. I love to use the left over ham in this recipe too: http://allrecipes.com/recipe/old-fashioned-mac-and-cheese/detail.aspx
Easy to prepare and makes the ham taste super yummy. I used a little less orange juice and added some pineapple juice for a little extra zing. Very good.
What a great and simple recipe. It turned out to moist and flavorful. I had to use about 1/4 c maple syrup and 1/4 c honey because I didn't have enough honey and it was delicious!
Followed directions and put in crock pot on low for 6-8 hrs. Was fantastic.
I used this glaze the first time I ever made ham and it was a huge hit!
Easy, and worked great.
just had this tonight was very good and one that I can remember!
Simple and great!

I hate ham, but my mother-in-law ordered me to make one for Easter dinner (we had it a day early this year). I bought a Costco pre-cooked and pre-sliced ham and used this glaze instead of the one that came in the package with the ham. I made extra glaze and was very, very generous with the glaze when cooking, and also put some out on the table so people could put extra glaze on their ham, if desired (I can only tolerate ham when it has tons of yummy glaze to cover up the hammy taste). OMG -- the ham was DELICIOUS. Everyone commented about how good it was, and my husband said it was better than Honey Baked Ham. This is my new favorite main course to serve when entertaining since it is so darn easy and stress-free.
Delicious & EASY!!! Everyone loved it.

We've been trying to find a simple yet tasty glaze for our Thanksgiving ham and found and tried this recipe. We are so glad we did! It's Christmas now and we are making another ham using this recipe. 
Mele Kalikimaka!
Just a simple and straight to the point glaze. Seriously no room for error here. Tastes wonderful and super easy.
Loved it! Prepared it exactly as directed, so simple and good!
Excellent! I added a tablespoon of cinnamon to it and the kids love it!
